module.name: LCLType
module.short: Provides compatibility with the Delphi Windows unit.

descr.p: lcltype.pp was created specifically for compatibility with Delphi. It should only be used for constants and type definitions that are included in the Delphi Windows unit. This is done only for compatibility.

element.name: TUTF8Char
element.short: A type that can hold an UTF-8 encoded character.

element.name: UINT
element.short: A 32-bit unsigned integer.

element.name: UINT_PTR
element.short: Unsigned integer type with same size as Pointer.

element.name: TTranslateString
element.short: Alias for the String type.

descr.p: TTranslateString is the type used to represent string values that can be translated using the localization facilities found in the LCL and the Lazarus IDE. Properties, constants, variables, and parameter values defined using this type can be localized using translation classes found in the lcltranslator unit.

element.name: TCriticalSection
element.short: Alias for the PtrUInt type.

descr.p: TCriticalSection is the type used to protect access to resources in a multi-threaded application. Please note that the type is different than the TRTLCriticalSection type and the class by the same name implemented in the syncobjs unit in the FPC RTL (Run-Time Library).

element.name: TDockImageOperation
element.short: Actions occurring while dragging an image.

element.name: TDockImageOperation.disShow
element.short: Show the image.

element.name: TDockImageOperation.disMove
element.short: Move the already visible image.

element.name: TDockImageOperation.disHide
element.short: Hide the image.

element.name: THandle
element.short: Alias to the PtrUInt type.

descr.p: Defined for platforms other than Windows. Needed because THandle in the RTL SysUtils unit is defined as longint.

element.name: HKEY
element.short: Handle to a registry key.

element.name: HDC
element.short: The type for a Device Context Handle.

element.name: HHOOK
element.short: Handle for a callback routine.

element.name: HFONT
element.short: The type of a Font Handle.

element.name: HGDIOBJ
element.short: The type of a general GraphicsDeviceInterface Object Handle.
element.descr: GDI objects are e.g. fonts or brushes, used in GDI drawing operations.

element.name: HPEN
element.short: The type of a line drawing Pen Handle.

element.name: HRGN
element.short: The type of a display Region Handle.

descr.p: A region can be as simple as a rectangle, or can be composed of multiple shapes.
Regions are almost used to restrict painting to certain areas of the screen (clipping).

element.name: HINST
element.short: The type of a (process) Instance Handle.

element.name: HICON
element.short: The type of an Icon Handle.

element.name: HIMAGELIST
element.short: The type of an Image List Handle.

descr.p: Image lists are frequently used with controls, whose display items (list entries...) can also show an image. Then every item refers to its image by an index into the shared image list, instead of holding a copy of the image.

element.name: HCURSOR
element.short: The type for a mouse Cursor Handle.

element.name: HGLOBAL
element.short: The type for a Global memory block Handle.
element.descr: Global memory blocks are managed by the platform, used e.g. for data shared across multiple processes.

element.name: HWND
element.short: The type of a Window Handle.
element.descr: Windows are managed by the platform's window manager. A window can be stand-alone (TForm) or embeddable (TWinControl).

element.name: HMENU
element.short: The type of a Menu Handle.

element.name: HBITMAP
element.short: The type of a Bitmap Handle.

element.name: HPALETTE
element.short: The type of a color Palette Handle.
element.descr: A color palette is frequently used in compressed bitmaps, which contain short (1..8 bit) palette indices instead of RGB colors, for every pixel.

element.name: HBRUSH
element.short: The type of a painting Brush Handle.
element.descr: A brush is used to fill image areas. Typical brush properties are color, pattern and fill style.

element.name: HMONITOR
element.short: The type of a display Monitor (CRT...) Handle.

element.name: Bool
element.short: A LongBool type, distinct from the Boolean type.

element.name: Short
element.short: A SmallInt type.

element.name: PRect
element.short: A pointer to TRect.

element.name: WPARAM
element.short: Type of the first message argument (pointer-sized).

element.name: LPARAM
element.short: Type of the second message argument (pointer-sized).

element.name: LRESULT
element.short: Type of a message result (pointer-sized).

element.name: ULONG_PTR
element.short: Alias for the PtrUInt type.

element.name: TLCLIntfHandle
element.short: Alias for the THandle type.

descr.p: TLCLIntfHandle is the type returned from the CreateHandle method in widgetset classes.

element.name: INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE
element.short: Value representing an invalid (unassigned) Handle.

element.name: MaxByte
element.short: Maximum value for the WinAPI BYTE type ($FF).

element.name: MAXWORD
element.short: Maximum value for the WinAPI WORD type ($FFFF).

element.name: MAXDWORD
element.short: Maximum value for the WinAPI DWORD type ($FFFF FFFF).

element.name: MINCHAR
element.short: Minimum value for the WinAPI CHAR type ($80).

element.name: MAXCHAR
element.short: Maximum value for the WinAPI CHAR type ($7F).

element.name: MINSHORT
element.short: Minimum value for the WinAPI SHORT type ($8000).

element.name: MAXSHORT
element.short: Maximum value for the WinAPI SHORT type ($7FFF).

element.name: MINLONG
element.short: Minimum value for the WinAPI LONG type ($8000 0000).

element.name: MAXLONG
element.short: Maximum value for the WinAPI LONG type ($7FFF FFFF).

element.name: R2_BLACK
element.short: Binary raster operation (Dst op Pen): all black.

element.name: R2_NOTMERGEPEN
element.short: Binary raster operation (Dst op Pen): not (Dst or Pen).

element.name: R2_MASKNOTPEN
element.short: Binary raster operation (Dst op Pen): Dst and not Pen.

element.name: R2_NOTCOPYPEN
element.short: Binary raster operation (Dst op Pen): not Pen.

element.name: R2_MASKPENNOT
element.short: Binary raster operation (Dst op Pen): (not Dst) and Pen.

element.name: R2_NOT
element.short: Binary raster operation (Dst op Pen): not Dst.

element.name: R2_XORPEN
element.short: Binary raster operation (Dst op Pen): Dst xor Pen.

element.name: R2_NOTMASKPEN
element.short: Binary raster operation (Dst op Pen): not (Dst and Pen).

element.name: R2_MASKPEN
element.short: Binary raster operation (Dst op Pen): Dst and Pen.

element.name: R2_NOTXORPEN
element.short: Binary raster operation (Dst op Pen): not (Dst xor Pen).

element.name: R2_NOP
element.short: Binary raster operation (Dst op Pen): Dst.

element.name: R2_MERGENOTPEN
element.short: Binary raster operation (Dst op Pen): Dst or not Pen.

element.name: R2_COPYPEN
element.short: Binary raster operation (Dst op Pen): Pen.

element.name: R2_MERGEPENNOT
element.short: Binary raster operation (Dst op Pen): (not Dst) or Pen.

element.name: R2_MERGEPEN
element.short: Binary raster operation (Dst op Pen): Dst or Pen.

element.name: R2_WHITE
element.short: Binary raster operation (Dst op Pen): all white.

element.name: R2_LAST
element.short: Highest binary raster operation code.

element.name: SRCCOPY
element.short: Ternary raster operation (Dst op Src op Pattern): Fills the destination area with Src.

element.name: SRCPAINT
element.short: Ternary raster operation (Dst op Src op Pattern): Fills the destination area with (Dst or Src).

element.name: SRCAND
element.short: Ternary raster operation (Dst op Src op Pattern): Fills the destination area with (Dst and Src).

element.name: SRCINVERT
element.short: Ternary raster operation (Dst op Src op Pattern): Fills the destination area with (Dst xor Src).

element.name: SRCERASE
element.short: Ternary raster operation (Dst op Src op Pattern): Fills the destination area with ((not Dst) and Src).

element.name: NOTSRCCOPY
element.short: Ternary raster operation (Dst op Src op Pattern): Fills the destination area with (not Src).

element.name: NOTSRCERASE
element.short: Ternary raster operation (Dst op Src op Pattern): Fills the destination area with (not (Dst or Src)).

element.name: MERGECOPY
element.short: Ternary raster operation (Dst op Src op Pattern): Fills the destination area with (Src and Pattern).

element.name: MERGEPAINT
element.short: Ternary raster operation (Dst op Src op Pattern): Fills the destination area with (Dst or not Src).

element.name: PATCOPY
element.short: Ternary raster operation (Dst op Src op Pattern): Fills the destination area with (Pattern).

element.name: PATPAINT
element.short: Ternary raster operation (Dst op Src op Pattern): Fills the destination area with (Dst or (not Src) or Pattern).

element.name: PATINVERT
element.short: Ternary raster operation (Dst op Src op Pattern): Fills the destination area with (Dst xor Pattern).

element.name: DSTINVERT
element.short: Ternary raster operation (Dst op Src op Pattern): Fills the destination area with (not Dst).

element.name: BLACKNESS
element.short: Ternary raster operation (Dst op Src op Pattern): Fills the destination area with all black.

element.name: WHITENESS
element.short: Ternary raster operation (Dst op Src op Pattern): Fills the destination area with all white.

element.name: TKeyBoardState
element.short: State array of 256 possible (virtual) keys.

element.name: _ABC
element.short: Record describing the width of a TrueType character.

descr.p: The effective display width for a single character is A+B+C.
The width of multiple characters should exclude the first A and last C value.
Negative A and C values allow for underhangs or overhangs, e.g. italics.

element.name: _ABC.abcA
element.short: The (possibly negative) distance to add to the current position before drawing the character glyph.

element.name: _ABC.abcB
element.short: The width of the character glyph.

element.name: _ABC.abcC
element.short: The (possibly negative) distance to add to the current position after drawing the character glyph.

element.name: ETO_OPAQUE
element.short: Opaque ExtTextOut mode, filling the rectangle with the background Color before painting the text.

element.name: ETO_CLIPPED
element.short: Clipped ExtTextOut mode, clipping the text at the rectangle boundaries.

element.name: CS_VREDRAW
element.short: Class style constant used to redraw the entire window when the height for the client area has been changed.

element.name: CS_HREDRAW
element.short: Class style constant used to redraw the entire window when the width for the client area has been changed.

element.name: RGN_AND
element.short: CombineRgn mode: intersection (r1 AND r2).

element.name: RGN_OR
element.short: CombineRgn mode: union (r1 OR r2).

element.name: RGN_XOR
element.short: CombineRgn mode: logical difference (r1 XOR r2).

element.name: RGN_DIFF
element.short: CombineRgn mode: arithmetic difference (r1 - r2).

element.name: RGN_COPY
element.short: CombineRgn mode: copy of r1.

element.name: DT_TOP
element.short: DrawText formatting: text justified to the top of the rectangle.

element.name: DT_LEFT
element.short: DrawText formatting: text justified to the left of the rectangle.

element.name: DT_CENTER
element.short: DrawText formatting: text centered horizontally within the rectangle.

element.name: DT_RIGHT
element.short: DrawText formatting: text justified to the right of the rectangle.

element.name: DT_VCENTER
element.short: DrawText formatting: text centered vertically within the rectangle.

element.name: DT_BOTTOM
element.short: DrawText formatting: text justified to the bottom of the rectangle.

element.name: DT_WORDBREAK
element.short: DrawText formatting: text can wrap into multiple lines.

element.name: DT_SINGLELINE
element.short: DrawText formatting: text is drawn in a single line, regardless of embedded line endings.

element.name: DT_EXPANDTABS
element.short: DrawText formatting: expand tab characters.

element.name: DT_NOCLIP
element.short: DrawText formatting: text is drawn without clipping.

element.name: DT_CALCRECT
element.short: DrawText formatting: returns the required rectangle, without actually drawing.

element.name: DT_NOPREFIX
element.short: DrawText formatting: show embedded '&' characters.

element.name: DT_INTERNAL
element.short: DrawText formatting: uses the system font for calculations.

element.name: DT_EDITCONTROL
element.short: DrawText formatting: emulate behavior of a multiline EDIT control.

element.name: DT_END_ELLIPSIS
element.short: DrawText formatting: appends an ellipsis when the text is truncated.

element.name: DT_MODIFYSTRING
element.short: DrawText formatting: update the string to match the displayed text (possibly truncated).

element.name: DT_RTLREADING
element.short: DrawText formatting: use right-to-left reading layout for bidirectional text.

element.name: DT_HIDEPREFIX
element.short: DrawText formatting flag: Ignore the accelerator key prefix (&) and hide the underline.

element.name: DT_PREFIXONLY
element.short: DrawText formatting flag: Draw only the underlined accelerator key, ignore any other text.

element.name: DFC_CAPTION
element.short: DrawFrameControl control type: title bar.

element.name: DFC_MENU
element.short: DrawFrameControl control type: menu bar.

element.name: DFC_SCROLL
element.short: DrawFrameControl control type: scroll bar.

element.name: DFC_BUTTON
element.short: DrawFrameControl control type: button.

element.name: DFC_POPUPMENU
element.short: DrawFrameControl control type: menu item.

element.name: DFCS_BUTTONCHECK
element.short: DrawFrameControl button control style: checkbox.

element.name: DFCS_BUTTONRADIOIMAGE
element.short: DrawFrameControl button control style: radio button image.

element.name: DFCS_BUTTONRADIOMASK
element.short: DrawFrameControl button control style: radio button mask.

element.name: DFCS_BUTTONRADIO
element.short: DrawFrameControl button control style: radio button.

element.name: DFCS_BUTTON3STATE
element.short: DrawFrameControl button control style: three-state button.

element.name: DFCS_BUTTONPUSH
element.short: DrawFrameControl button control style: push button.

element.name: DFCS_CAPTIONCLOSE
element.short: DrawFrameControl caption control style: Close button.

element.name: DFCS_CAPTIONMIN
element.short: DrawFrameControl caption control style: Minimize button.

element.name: DFCS_CAPTIONMAX
element.short: DrawFrameControl caption control style: Maximize button.

element.name: DFCS_CAPTIONRESTORE
element.short: DrawFrameControl caption control style: Restore button.

element.name: DFCS_CAPTIONHELP
element.short: DrawFrameControl caption control style: Help button.

element.name: DFCS_MENUARROW
element.short: DrawFrameControl menubar control style: sub-menu arrow.

element.name: DFCS_MENUCHECK
element.short: DrawFrameControl menubar control style: check mark.

element.name: DFCS_MENUBULLET
element.short: DrawFrameControl menubar control style: bullet.

element.name: DFCS_SCROLLDOWN
element.short: DrawFrameControl scrollbar control style: down arrow.

element.name: DFCS_SCROLLLEFT
element.short: DrawFrameControl scrollbar control style: left arrow.

element.name: DFCS_SCROLLRIGHT
element.short: DrawFrameControl scrollbar control style: right arrow.

element.name: DFCS_SCROLLCOMBOBOX
element.short: DrawFrameControl scrollbar control style: combobox scrollbar.

element.name: DFCS_SCROLLSIZEGRIP
element.short: DrawFrameControl scrollbar control style: size grip in the bottom-right window corner.

element.name: DFCS_SCROLLUP
element.short: DrawFrameControl scrollbar control style: up arrow.

element.name: DFCS_INACTIVE
element.short: DrawFrameControl control state: inactive (grayed).

element.name: DFCS_PUSHED
element.short: DrawFrameControl button control state: button pushed.

element.name: DFCS_CHECKED
element.short: DrawFrameControl button control state: button checked.

element.name: DFCS_TRANSPARENT
element.short: DrawFrameControl control style: transparent (title bar...).

element.name: DFCS_HOT
element.short: DrawFrameControl scrollbar control state: button hot-tracked.

element.name: DFCS_ADJUSTRECT
element.short: DrawFrameControl button control style: exclude frame.

element.name: DFCS_FLAT
element.short: DrawFrameControl button control style: flat.

element.name: DFCS_MONO
element.short: DrawFrameControl button control style: monochrome border.

element.name: HTERROR
element.short: Hit test error (like HTNOWHERE) which produces a system beep.

element.name: HTTRANSPARENT
element.short: Hit test: transparent area.

element.name: HTNOWHERE
element.short: Hit test: outside control.

element.name: HTCLIENT
element.short: Hit test: client area.

element.name: HTCAPTION
element.short: Hit test: caption background.

element.name: MSGF_DIALOGBOX
element.short: Indicates an input event occurred in a dialog.

element.name: MSGF_MESSAGEBOX
element.short: Indicates an input event occurred in a message box.

element.name: MSGF_MENU
element.short: Indicates an input event occurred in a menu.

element.name: MSGF_SCROLLBAR
element.short: Indicates an input event occurred in a scroll bar.

element.name: MSGF_NEXTWINDOW
element.short: Indicates an ALT+TAB input event occurred to activate the next window.

element.name: PM_Noremove
element.short: PeekMessage flag: don't remove peeked message.

element.name: PM_Remove
element.short: PeekMessage flag: remove peeked message.

element.name: MF_BYCOMMAND
element.short: Find menu item by command ID.

element.name: MF_BYPOSITION
element.short: Find menu item by position number.

element.name: MF_SEPARATOR
element.short: Menu flag to draw a horizontal separator.

element.name: MF_ENABLED
element.short: Menu flag to enable a menu item for selection.

element.name: MF_GRAYED
element.short: Menu flag to disable a menu item and prevent its selection.

element.name: MF_DISABLED
element.short: Menu flag to disable a menu item and prevent its selection, but it does not gray the menu item.

element.name: MF_UNCHECKED
element.short: Menu to flag to draw the item without a check mark, even when a bitmap is supplied for the menu item.

element.name: MF_CHECKED
element.short: Menu flag to draw a check mark for the menu item.

element.name: MF_USECHECKBITMAPS
element.short: Menu flag to enable check mark bitmaps for menu items.

element.name: MF_STRING
element.short: Menu flag which specifies a menu item as a text value.

element.name: MF_BITMAP
element.short: Menu flag which specifies a menu item as a bitmap image.

element.name: MF_OWNERDRAW
element.short: Menu flag which specified the menu item is owner-drawn. Indicates that WM_MEASUREITEM and WM_DRAWITEM messages are used when the menu item is updated.

element.name: MF_POPUP
element.short: Menu flag which specifies the menu item is a a pop-up, drop-down, or sub-menu.

element.name: MF_MENUBARBREAK
element.short: Menu flag, like MF_MENUBREAK, but used for a menu bar. Causes a menu, sub-menu, or short cut to be displayed in a new column with a vertical separator.

element.name: MF_MENUBREAK
element.short: Menu flag, like MF_MENUBARBREAK, but used for a menu item. Causes the new menu item to appear on a separate line (menu bar) or column (menu, sub-menu, or short cut) without a separator line.

element.name: MF_UNHILITE
element.short: Menu flag used to remove highlighting from a menu item.

element.name: MF_HILITE
element.short: Menu flag used to add highlighting to a menu item. When omitted, the MF_UNHILITE menu flag is assumed.

element.name: MF_DEFAULT
element.short: Menu flag used to indicate that an item is the default selection for a menu.

element.name: MF_SYSMENU
element.short: Menu flag which indicates if the menu item appears on the Window menu.

element.name: MF_RIGHTJUSTIFY
element.short: Menu flag which indicates the menu item caption is right aligned.

element.name: MF_MOUSESELECT
element.short: Menu flag which indicates the item has been selected using the mouse.

element.name: MF_UNSUPPORTED
element.short: Mask used to filter menu flag values.

element.name: KF_EXTENDED
element.short: Focus and activation key flag used to test for extended key values.

element.name: KF_DLGMODE
element.short: Focus and activation key flag which indicates if a dialog is active.

element.name: KF_MENUMODE
element.short: Focus and activation key flag which indicates if a menu is active.

element.name: KF_ALTDOWN
element.short: Focus and activation key flag which indicates if the Alt key is pressed.

element.name: KF_REPEAT
element.short: Focus and activation key flag used to manipulate the previous key state flag.

element.name: KF_UP
element.short: Focus and activation key flag used to manipulate a key state transition flag.

element.name: scMeta
element.short: Represents the Meta key in a short cut value.

element.name: VK_UNKNOWN
element.short: Virtual key code for an unknown key (defined by the LCL).

element.name: VK_LBUTTON
element.short: Virtual key code (Windows API compatible).

element.name: VK_RBUTTON
element.short: Virtual key code (Windows API compatible).

element.name: VK_CANCEL
element.short: Virtual key code (Windows API compatible).

element.name: VK_MBUTTON
element.short: Virtual key code for the middle mouse button (Windows API compatible).

element.name: VK_XBUTTON1
element.short: Virtual key code for the first extra mouse button (Windows API compatible).

element.name: VK_XBUTTON2
element.short: Virtual key code for the second extra mouse button (Windows API compatible).

element.name: VK_BACK
element.short: Virtual key code for the Backspace key. Not to be confused with the Android BACK navigation key which is mapped to VK_ESCAPE.

descr.p: Not equivalent to anything less than $FF. Will only be sent by a primary "@" key but not for a @ key as secondary action of a "2" key, for example.

element.name: BDR_RAISEDOUTER
element.short: Represents a 3-D border style with a raised outer border.

element.name: BDR_SUNKENOUTER
element.short: Represents a 3-D border style with a sunken outer border.

element.name: BDR_RAISEDINNER
element.short: Represents a 3-D border style with a raised inner border.

element.name: BDR_SUNKENINNER
element.short: Represents a 3-D border style with a sunken inner border.

element.name: BDR_OUTER
element.short: Indicates whether an outer border (raised or sunken) is in use for a control.

element.name: BDR_INNER
element.short: Indicates whether an inner border (raised or sunken) is in use for a control.

element.name: BDR_RAISED
element.short: Indicates whether a raised border (inner or outer) is in use for a control.

element.name: BDR_SUNKEN
element.short: Indicates whether a sunken border (inner or outer) is in use for a control.

element.name: EDGE_BUMP
element.short: Combination of BDR_RAISEDOUTER and BDR_SUNKENINNER.

element.name: EDGE_ETCHED
element.short: Combination of BDR_SUNKENOUTER and BDR_RAISEDINNER.

element.name: EDGE_RAISED
element.short: Combination of BDR_RAISEDOUTER and BDR_RAISEDINNER.

element.name: EDGE_SUNKEN
element.short: Combination of BDR_SUNKENOUTER and BDR_SUNKENINNER.

element.name: BF_LEFT
element.short: Border flag representing the left side of a border rectangle.

element.name: BF_TOP
element.short: Border flag representing the top edge of a border rectangle.

element.name: BF_RIGHT
element.short: Border flag representing the right side of a border rectangle.

element.name: BF_BOTTOM
element.short: Border flag representing the bottom edge of a border rectangle.

element.name: BF_TOPLEFT
element.short: Border flag representing the top and left sides of a border rectangle.

element.name: BF_TOPRIGHT
element.short: Border flag representing the top and right sides of a border rectangle.

element.name: BF_BOTTOMLEFT
element.short: Border flag representing the bottom and left sides of a border rectangle.

element.name: BF_BOTTOMRIGHT
element.short: Border flag representing the bottom and right sides of a border rectangle.

element.name: BF_RECT
element.short: Border flag representing all sides of a border rectangle.

element.name: BF_DIAGONAL
element.short: Border flag representing a diagonal border.

element.name: BF_DIAGONAL_ENDTOPRIGHT
element.short: Border flag representing a diagonal border where the origin is the bottom-left corner and the terminus is the top-right corner of the rectangle.

element.name: MB_OK
element.short: Indicates a message box includes an Ok button.

element.name: MB_OKCANCEL
element.short: Indicates a message box includes Ok and Cancel buttons.

element.name: MB_ABORTRETRYIGNORE
element.short: Indicates a message box includes Abort, Retry, and Ignore buttons.

element.name: MB_YESNOCANCEL
element.short: Indicates a message box includes Yes, No, and Cancel buttons.

element.name: MB_YESNO
element.short: Indicates a message box includes Yes and No buttons.

element.name: MB_RETRYCANCEL
element.short: Indicates a message box includes Retry and Cancel buttons.

element.name: MB_CANCELTRYCONTINUE
element.short: Indicates a message box includes Cancel, Retry, and Continue buttons.

descr.p: Not yet supported by MessageDlg.

element.name: MB_HELP
element.short: Indicates a message box includes a Help button.

descr.p: Not yet supported by MessageDlg.

element.name: MB_ICONHAND
element.short: Indicates that a message box displays a Stop Sign icon.

element.name: MB_ICONQUESTION
element.short: Indicates that a message box displays a Question Mark icon.

element.name: MB_ICONEXCLAMATION
element.short: Indicates that a message box displays an Exclamation Point icon.

element.name: SIF_Range
element.short: Request for the scrollbar range.

element.name: SIF_PAGE
element.short: Request for the scrollbar page size.

element.name: SIF_POS
element.short: Request for the scrollbar position.

element.name: SIF_DISABLENOSCROLL
element.short: Disable the scrollbar if not needed.

element.name: SIF_TRACKPOS
element.short: Request for the scrollbar tracking position.

element.name: SIF_ALL
element.short: Request all scrollbar properties.

descr.p: Defined for the LCL.

element.name: tagScrollInfo
element.short: The Scrollbar properties parameter record.

descr.p: This record is used with the GetScrollInfo and SetScrollInfo procedures. before every call fMask must be initialized with the flags for the desired values:

ul.li: SIF_DISABLENOSCROLL: when the new parameters make the scrollbar unnecessary, the scrollbar is only disabled, not removed. (write only)
SIF_PAGE: nPage contains the page size.
SIF_POS: nPos contains the slider position.
SIF_RANGE: nMin and nMax contain the scroll limits.
SIF_TRACKPOS: nTrackPos contains the current slider position, while the user is dragging the slider. (read only)

element.name: tagScrollInfo.cbSize
element.short: Must be initialized to sizeof(TScrollInfo).

element.name: tagScrollInfo.fMask
element.short: Contains the flags for the desired values.

element.name: tagScrollInfo.nMin
element.short: The minimum Position value.

element.name: tagScrollInfo.nMax
element.short: The maximum Position value.

element.name: tagScrollInfo.nPage
element.short: The page size, equivalent to the slider size.

element.name: tagScrollInfo.nPos
element.short: The slider position.

element.name: tagScrollInfo.nTrackPos
element.short: The current position while the user is dragging the slider.

element.name: COLORREF
element.short: Represents color constants in the LCL.

descr.p: COLORREF is the type used for color constants defined in the LCL. It is interchangeable with the TColorRef type; TColorRef is an alias for COLORREF.

The base type used for the definition is dependent on the compiler version used to build the LCL. Starting in FPC version 3.2.3, the base type is the TColorRef type defined in the System.UITypes namespace in the FPC run-time library (RTL). For previous compiler versions, the base type is Cardinal.
This is done to prevent type conflicts when both System.UITypes and LCL units are used.
Values in COLORREF (and TColorRef) are normally OR'd with the value $80000000 to prevent interference with other MS color enumeration values.

element.name: TColorRef
element.short: Represents color constants in the LCL.

descr.p: TColorRef is an alias for the COLORREF type, and is used for color constants defined in the LCL.

Values from 0..$FFFFFF are BGR colors. The lowest 8 bit are the blue component, the middle 8 bit the green component and the highest 8 bit the red component. Use the functions Red, Green, Blue to extract the components, RedGreenBlue to extract all three components and RGBToColor to convert the three colors to a TColor.

Values with highest bit set are system colors or themed colors. For example clNone, clBackground, clButton, clWindowText. Their actual value depend on the context (i.e. the used Canvas) and they are not valid in all contexts. For example clWindowText might only work for Font.Color, not for Brush.Color or Pen.Color. clBackground might be a color, gradient, pattern or image, depending on theme and control type.

A system color can change during run-time, so do not store them. Use system colors only on LCL control Canvas. They probably are not defined for printer canvas and some are not defined on bitmap canvas.

element.name: CLR_NONE
element.short: Cardinal color value used for no color.

element.name: CLR_DEFAULT
element.short: Mask used to check for the default color value.

element.name: CLR_INVALID
element.short: Same as CLR_NONE

element.name: COLOR_SCROLLBAR
element.short: Offset into the system color map for the scroll bar color.

element.name: COLOR_BACKGROUND
element.short: Offset into the system color map for the background color.

element.name: COLOR_ACTIVECAPTION
element.short: Offset into the system color map for the active caption color.

element.name: COLOR_INACTIVECAPTION
element.short: Offset into the system color map for the inactive caption color.

element.name: COLOR_MENU
element.short: Offset into the system color map for the menu color.

element.name: COLOR_WINDOW
element.short: Offset into the system color map for the window color.

element.name: COLOR_WINDOWFRAME
element.short: Offset into the system color map for the window frame or border color.

element.name: COLOR_MENUTEXT
element.short: Offset into the system color map for the menu text color.

element.name: COLOR_WINDOWTEXT
element.short: Offset into the system color map for the window text color.

element.name: COLOR_CAPTIONTEXT
element.short: Offset into the system color map for the caption text color.

element.name: COLOR_INACTIVEBORDER
element.short: Offset into the system color map for the inactive border color.

element.name: COLOR_APPWORKSPACE
element.short: Offset into the system color map for the workspace color.

element.name: COLOR_HIGHLIGHT
element.short: Offset into the system color map for the highlight color.

element.name: COLOR_HIGHLIGHTTEXT
element.short: Offset into the system color map for the highlighted text color.

element.name: COLOR_BTNFACE
element.short: Offset into the system color map for the button face color.

element.name: COLOR_BTNSHADOW
element.short: Offset into the system color map for the button shadow color.

element.name: COLOR_GRAYTEXT
element.short: Offset into the system color map for the grayed or inactive text color.

element.name: COLOR_BTNTEXT
element.short: Offset into the system color map for the button text color.

element.name: MAX_SYS_COLORS
element.short: Maximum number of system colors.

descr.p: Same as COLOR_ENDCOLORS.

element.name: WHITE_BRUSH
element.short: Represents the stock object for a white brush.

element.name: LTGRAY_BRUSH
element.short: Represents the stock object for a light gray brush.

element.name: GRAY_BRUSH
element.short: Represents the stock object for a gray brush.

element.name: DKGRAY_BRUSH
element.short: Represents the stock object for a dark gray brush.

element.name: BLACK_BRUSH
element.short: Represents the stock object for a black brush.

element.name: NULL_BRUSH
element.short: Represents the stock object for an undefined brush.

element.name: HOLLOW_BRUSH
element.short: Same as NULL_BRUSH.

element.name: WHITE_PEN
element.short: Represents the stock object for a white pen.

element.name: BLACK_PEN
element.short: Represents the stock object for a black pen.

element.name: NULL_PEN
element.short: Represents an undefined pen.

element.name: OEM_FIXED_FONT
element.short: Represents the stock object for an OEM fixed-pitch font.

element.name: ANSI_FIXED_FONT
element.short: Represents the stock object for an ANSI fixed-pitch font.

element.name: ANSI_VAR_FONT
element.short: Represents the stock object for an ANSI variable-pitch font.

element.name: SYSTEM_FONT
element.short: Represents the stock object for the system font.

element.name: DEVICE_DEFAULT_FONT
element.short: Represents the stock object for a default device font.

element.name: DEFAULT_PALETTE
element.short: Represents the stock object for the default system color palette.

element.name: SYSTEM_FIXED_FONT
element.short: Represents the stock object for the fixed-pitch system font.

element.name: DEFAULT_GUI_FONT
element.short: Represents the stock object for the default GUI font.

element.name: DC_BRUSH
element.short: Represents the stock object with a device context for a brush.

element.name: DC_PEN
element.short: Represents the stock object with a device context for a pen.

element.name: STOCK_LAST
element.short: Upper limit for stock object index definitions.

element.name: idButtonBase
element.short: Lower limit for the stock pixmap type indexes.

element.name: idDialogShield
element.short: Represents the pixmap containing the shield image used on dialogs.

element.name: OBJ_PEN
element.short: Device context object type for a pen.

element.name: OBJ_BRUSH
element.short: Device context object type for a brush.

element.name: OBJ_DC
element.short: Device context object type for a device handle.

element.name: OBJ_METADC
element.short: Device context object type for a device handle with metadata.

element.name: OBJ_PAL
element.short: Device context object type for a palette.

element.name: OBJ_FONT
element.short: Device context object type for a font.

element.name: OBJ_BITMAP
element.short: Device context object type for a bitmap image.

element.name: OBJ_REGION
element.short: Device context object type for a region.

element.name: OBJ_METAFILE
element.short: Device context object type for a metafile (.wmf).

element.name: SM_CXSCREEN
element.short: System metric index used to get the width in pixels of the screen for the primary display monitor.

element.name: SM_CYSCREEN
element.short: System metric index used to get the height in pixels of the screen for the primary display monitor.

element.name: SM_CXVSCROLL
element.short: System metric index used to get the width of a vertical scroll bar in pixels.

element.name: SM_CYHSCROLL
element.short: System metric index used to get the height of a horizontal scroll bar in pixels.

element.name: SM_CYCAPTION
element.short: System metric index used to get the height of the caption area in pixels.

element.name: SM_CXBORDER
element.short: System metric index used to get the width of the window border in pixels. Same as SM_CXEDGE when the windows uses 3-D borders.

element.name: SM_CYBORDER
element.short: System metric index used to get the height of the window border in pixels. Same as SM_CYEDGE when the windows uses 3-D borders.

element.name: SM_CXDLGFRAME
element.short: Same as SM_CXFIXEDFRAME.

element.name: SM_CYDLGFRAME
element.short: Same as SM_CYFIXEDFRAME.

element.name: SM_LCLMAXIMIZEDWIDTH
element.short: Defined to get accurate maximized window width under X11.

element.name: SM_LCLMAXIMIZEDHEIGHT
element.short: Defined to get accurate maximized height under X11.

element.name: SM_LCLHasFormAlphaBlend
element.short: Indicates if a form uses Alpha channel transparency.

element.name: SM_REMOTESESSION
element.short: System metric index used to determine if the calling process is a terminal services client session (non-zero return value) or a console session (zero return value). A console session does not have to be the physical console.

element.name: SPI_GETBEEP
element.short: Gets the state for warning beeps from system parameter information.

element.name: SPI_SETBEEP
element.short: Sets warning beeps on or off using system parameter information.

element.name: SPI_GETMOUSE
element.short: Gets mouse threshold and acceleration values from system parameter information.

element.name: SPI_GETFONTSMOOTHINGORIENTATION
element.short: Gets the color orientation for font smoothing from system parameter information.

element.name: SPI_SETFONTSMOOTHINGORIENTATION
element.short: Sets the color orientation for font smoothing using system parameter information.

element.name: HORZSIZE
element.short: Horizontal size in millimeters.

element.name: VERTSIZE
element.short: Vertical size in millimeters.

element.name: HORZRES
element.short: Horizontal width in pixels for a device context.

element.name: VERTRES
element.short: Vertical height in pixels for a device context.

element.name: BITSPIXEL
element.short: Number of bits per pixel.

element.name: PLANES
element.short: Number of color planes.

element.name: LOGPIXELSX
element.short: The number of pixels per logical inch, in X (horizontal) direction.

element.name: LOGPIXELSY
element.short: The number of pixels per logical inch, in Y (vertical) direction.

element.name: SIZEPALETTE
element.short: Number of entries in the color palette.

element.name: NUMRESERVED
element.short: Number of reserved entries in the color palette.

element.name: tagLOGBRUSH
element.short: Description of a Brush.

descr.p: A brush has a color and a pattern.
The content of lbColor and lbHatch varies, depending on lbStyle.
When a drawing function fills an area, using the current brush, a BS_HOLLOW brush can be used to suppress filling.

element.name: tagLOGBRUSH.lbStyle
element.short: The brush style, e.g. BS_SOLID or BS_HATCHED.

element.name: tagLOGBRUSH.lbColor
element.short: The brush color, a TColorRef for BS_SOLID or BS_HATCHED.

element.name: tagLOGBRUSH.lbHatch
element.short: Polymorphic, depending on lbStyle. With style BS_HATCHED lbHatch is a pattern constant, e.g. HS_VERTICAL.

element.name: TClipboardFormat
element.short: Alias for the PtrUInt type.

descr.p: TClipboardFormat is the type passed as an argument to TClipboardRequestEvent event handlers, and to routines in the graphics and clipbrd units.

element.name: PClipboardFormat
element.short: Pointer to a TClipboardFormat type.

element.name: TClipboardRequestEvent
element.short: Specifies an event handler signalled to get a stream instance with the data for a given clipboard format.

descr.p: TClipboardRequestEvent is the type used to represent an event handler procedure for clipboard requests in widgetset classes. It is the type used to implement the OnRequest event handler in TClipboard.

element.name: TClipboardType
element.short: Represents the sources or dispositions for clipboard data.

descr.p: Used for platforms / window managers / desktop environments that support more than on clipboard. It appears to be inherently tied to the ICCCM protocol developed by freedesktop.org. Values in the enumeration are used in widgetset classes as an index to access the different clipboard storages.

element.name: TClipboardType.ctPrimarySelection
element.short: The clipboard is the one designated as PRIMARY for the desktop. Implies that it is used for commands that accept a single argument. Historically, it is used for mouse selections, pasting using the middle mouse button, and explicit cut/copy/paste operations initiated from a menu item.

element.name: TClipboardType.ctSecondarySelection
element.short: The clipboard is the one designated as SECONDARY for the desktop. Implies that it is used to exchange values for primary and secondary selections.

element.name: TClipboardType.ctClipboard
element.short: This is the clipboard type when the desktop does not support multiple clipboards, or when copy/cut and paste operations are performed between different clients.

element.name: ClipboardTypeName
element.short: Contains the names associated with the clipboard types accessed using the enumeration values.

element.name: TPredefinedClipboardFormat
element.short: Represents predefined clipboard formats used in the LCL.

descr.p: Values in the enumeration indicates the type of content stored on the clipboard. Values from the enumeration are passed as an argument to routines in the LCL interface, and used in the implementation of widgetset classes.

element.name: TPredefinedClipboardFormat.pcfText
element.short: Clipboard contains plain text.

element.name: TPredefinedClipboardFormat.pcfBitmap
element.short: Clipboard contains an image using the .BMP or Bitmap format.

element.name: TPredefinedClipboardFormat.pcfPixmap
element.short: Clipboard contains an image using the PixMap format.

element.name: TPredefinedClipboardFormat.pcfIcon
element.short: Clipboard contains an image using the .ico or Icon format.

element.name: TPredefinedClipboardFormat.pcfPicture
element.short: Clipboard contains an image using the TPicture format.

element.name: TPredefinedClipboardFormat.pcfObject
element.short: Clipboard contains an object (TObject) instance.

element.name: TPredefinedClipboardFormat.pcfComponent
element.short: Clipboard contains a component (TComponent) instance.

element.name: TPredefinedClipboardFormat.pcfCustomData
element.short: Clipboard contains data stored using an application-specific custom format.

element.name: PredefinedClipboardMimeTypes
element.short: Contains MIME types for the values in the TPredefinedClipboardFormat enumeration.

element.name: TListChangeEvent
element.short: Specifies an event handler signalled when a value in a TListWithEvent instance is modified.

descr.p: TListChangeEvent is the type used for the OnChange event handler property in TListWithEvent.

element.name: TListChangeEvent.Ptr
element.short: An untyped Pointer to the modified list item for the event.

element.name: TListChangeEvent.AnAction
element.short: Indicates the action performed for the list item that caused the notification event.

element.name: TListWithEvent
element.short: Implements a list with an event signalled when values are added or removed.

descr.p: TListWithEvent is a TList descendant which implements a list with an event handler signalled when values are added to or removed from the container. It provides an overridden Notify method which signals the event handler (when assigned) for add or delete operations. Assign an object procedure using the signature in TListChangeEvent to the OnChange event handler to respond to the notification.

element.name: TListWithEvent.FOnChange
element.short: Member used for the OnChange event handler.

element.name: TListWithEvent.Notify
element.short: Handles the notification when a value is added to or removed from the list.

descr.p: Notify is an overridden method in TListWithEvent. It calls the inherited method to notify registered observers of the change to the list. It signals the OnChange event handler (when assigned) using the values in Ptr and AnAction as arguments.

element.name: TListWithEvent.Notify.Ptr
element.short: Untyped pointer to the value for the notification.

element.name: TListWithEvent.Notify.AnAction
element.short: Operation performed for the specified value.

element.name: TListWithEvent.OnChange
element.short: Event handler signalled when a value is added to or removed from the list.

descr.p: Signalled from the Notify method (when assigned).

element.name: csNone
element.short: Component style identifier.

element.short: Component style identifier.

element.name: csComboBox
element.short: Component style identifier.

element.short: Component style identifier.

element.short: Component style identifier.

element.short: Component style identifier.

element.short: Component style identifier.

element.short: Component style identifier.

element.short: Component style identifier.

element.short: Component style identifier.

element.short: Component style identifier.

element.short: Component style identifier.

element.name: csToggleBox
element.short: Component style identifier.

element.short: Component style identifier.

element.name: csPage
element.short: Component style identifier.

element.name: csColorDialog
element.short: Component style identifier.

element.name: csListBox
element.short: Component style identifier.

element.name: csFontDialog
element.short: Component style identifier.

element.name: csProgressBar
element.short: Component style identifier.

element.name: csTrackBar
element.short: Component style identifier.

element.name: csWinControl
element.short: Component style identifier.

element.name: csFixed
element.short: Component style identifier.

element.name: csBitBtn
element.short: Component style identifier.

element.name: csCListBox
element.short: Component style identifier.

element.name: csPopupMenu
element.short: Component style identifier.

element.name: csHintWindow
element.short: Component style identifier.

element.name: csCalendar
element.short: Component style identifier.

element.name: csArrow
element.short: Component style identifier.

element.name: csPanel
element.short: Component style identifier.

element.name: csScrollBox
element.short: Component style identifier.

element.name: csCheckListBox
element.short: Component style identifier.

element.name: csPairSplitter
element.short: Component style identifier.

element.name: csPairSplitterSide
element.short: Component style identifier.

element.name: csOpenFileDialog
element.short: Component style identifier.

element.name: csSaveFileDialog
element.short: Component style identifier.

element.name: csSelectDirectoryDialog
element.short: Component style identifier.

element.name: csPreviewFileControl
element.short: Component style identifier.

element.name: csPreviewFileDialog
element.short: Component style identifier.

element.name: csNonLCL
element.short: Component style identifier. Used for non-LCL controls that create their own handles.

element.name: MK_LBUTTON
element.short: A key state constant to represent the left mouse button, equivalent to ssLeft from TShiftState.

element.name: MK_RBUTTON
element.short: A key state constant to represent the right mouse button, equivalent to ssRight from TShiftState.

element.name: MK_SHIFT
element.short: A key state constant to represent the shift key, equivalent to ssShift from TShiftState.

element.name: MK_CONTROL
element.short: A key state constant to represent the control key, equivalent to ssCtrl from TShiftState.

element.name: MK_MBUTTON
element.short: A key state constant to represent the middle mouse button, equivalent to ssMiddle from TShiftState.

element.name: MK_XBUTTON1
element.short: A key state constant to represent the first extra mouse button, equivalent to ssExtra1 from TShiftState.

element.name: MK_XBUTTON2
element.short: A key state constant to represent the second extra mouse button, equivalent to ssExtra2 from TShiftState.

element.name: LVN_ITEMCHANGING
element.short: List View notification message code for a pending change to an item.

element.name: LVN_ITEMCHANGED
element.short: List View notification message code for a completed change to an item.

element.name: PNMListView
element.short: Pointer to the TNMListView type.

element.name: TNMListView
element.short: Record type used for List View change notification messages.

element.name: _NM_LISTVIEW
element.short: Alias for the TNMListView type.

element.name: NM_LISTVIEW
element.short: Alias for the TNMListView type.

element.name: tagNMLISTVIEW
element.short: Alias for the TNMListView type.

element.name: TStockFont
element.short: Represents stock font types used in InitStockFont.

descr.p: Values in the enumeration are passed as an argument to the InitStockFont routine in the LCL interface, and used when a widgetset class calls its InitStockFont method.

element.name: TStockFont.sfSystem
element.short: Represents the stock system font.

element.name: TStockFont.sfHint
element.short: Represents the stock hint font.

element.name: TStockFont.sfIcon
element.short: Represents the stock icon font.

element.name: TStockFont.sfMenu
element.short: Represents the stock menu font.

element.name: CS_To_String
element.short: Converts a component style identifier to a component style name.

descr.p: The following values are not supported in the CompStyle argument, and cause 'Unknown component style' to be returned from the routine:
Not used in the current LCL implementation.

element.name: CS_To_String.Result
element.short: String representing the component style, or 'Unknown component style' for unsupported values.

element.name: CS_To_String.CompStyle
element.short: Integer component style identifier converted to its representation as a String.

element.name: HiWord
element.short: Gets the largest value for the specified Integer as a Word type.

element.name: HiWord.Result
element.short: Largest Word value for the specified Integer.

element.name: HiWord.i
element.short: Integer value examined in the routine.

element.name: LoWord
element.short: Gets the smallest value for the specified Integer as a Word type.

element.name: LoWord.Result
element.short: Smallest Word value for the specified Integer.

element.name: LoWord.i
element.short: Integer value examined in the routine.

element.name: Char2VK
element.short: Gets the virtual key code for the specified character value.

descr.p: The return value is 0 (zero) if the character in C is not an alphanumeric character in the ranges '0'..'9', 'a'..'z', or 'A'..'Z'.

element.name: Char2VK.Result
element.short: Virtual key code for the specified value.

element.name: Char2VK.C
element.short: Character value examined in the routine.

element.name: VK2Char
element.short: Gets the character value for the specified virtual key code.

element.name: VK2Char.Result
element.short: Character value for the specified virtual key code.

element.name: VK2Char.AVK
element.short: Virtual key code converted to a character in the routine.

element.name: MathRound
element.short: Rounds the specified Real value to an Int64 value.

element.name: MathRound.Result
element.short: Int64 type with the rounded value.

element.name: MathRound.AValue
element.short: Real type with the value rounded in the routine.

element.name: MulDiv
element.short: Multiples the numerator by the specified Integer value, and divides the result by the denominator value.

descr.p: Values passed in the arguments to the routine are Integer types. Values in nNumber and nNumerator are cast to Int64 values for the multiplication operation. MathRound is called to ensure that the result for the division operation is rounded for the Int64 type, and is cast to the Integer type used in the return value.
When nNumerator and nDenominator have the same value, the return value is set to nNumber. The return value is -1 if the value in nDenominator is 0 (zero).

element.name: MulDiv.Result
element.short: Integer result for the multiply and divide operations.

element.name: MulDiv.nNumber
element.short: Multiplicand for the operation.

element.name: MulDiv.nNumerator
element.short: Numerator multiplied by the specified value.

element.name: MulDiv.nDenominator
element.short: Denominator used for the division operation.

element.name: KeyToShortCut
element.short: Gets the short cut value for the specified key code and shift modifiers.

descr.p: The return value is determined by combining the value in Key with the Shift, Ctrl, Alt, or Meta modifiers in Shift. The return value is 0 if any of the high-order bits in Key are already set.

element.name: KeyToShortCut.Result
element.short: TShortCut value for the specified key code and shift modifier.

element.name: KeyToShortCut.Key
element.short: Key code for the short cut value.

element.name: KeyToShortCut.Shift
element.short: Shift, Ctrl, Alt, or Meta modifier for the short cut value.

element.name: CharSetToString
element.short: Gets a String with the name for the specified character set identifier.

element.name: CharSetToString.Result
element.short: Character set name for the specified identifier.

element.name: CharSetToString.Charset
element.short: Character set identifier converted to a name in the routine.

element.name: StringToCharset
element.short: Gets the character set identifier for the specified character set name.

element.name: StringToCharset.Result
element.short: Constant with the character set identifier for the specified character set name.

element.name: StringToCharset.Charset
element.short: Character set name converted to its identifier constant.
